name: "Action Comics" #1 Multiple Choice Quiz | DC Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is the object Superman is holding on the cover?
questions.explanation:
A car.

	The famous cover depicts Superman lifting a car over his head and crushing it against a rock.

questions.text: Why does Clark Kent apply for a job in the newspaper industry?
options: To be closer to Lois Lane
To hide Superman from the news media
questions.explanation:
To get news dispatches promptly.

	Clark wants to get a job at the newspaper so he get the news faster than everyone else.

questions.text: What newspaper does Clark work for?
questions.explanation:
The Daily Star & Daily Star.

	Even though he is later known as working for the Daily Planet, in "Action Comics" #1 he works for the Daily Star.

Bea Carroll.

	The night singer who killed Jack Kennedy and framed Evelyn Curry is Bea Carroll.

questions.text: Why does Clark throw the man at 211 Court Ave. against the wall?
options: He's the leader of a gang of crooks
questions.explanation:
He's beating a woman.

	The man is beating his wife with a belt, and Superman delivers justice!

questions.text: What does Lois do at the newspaper?
questions.explanation:
Writes sob stories.

	Lois complains to Clark on their date that she's "been scribbling 'sob stories' all day long."

questions.text: Why does Lois leave Clark on their date?
options: He's too busy worrying about crime
questions.explanation:
He's a coward.

	Clark doesn't want to give away his tremendous strength, so he kowtows to a bully at the dance, and Lois runs off saying that he is "a spineless, unbearable coward!"

Butch & Butch Mason & Butch Matson.

	Butch Matson, the bully from the dance, kidnaps Lois for not dancing with him.

questions.text: What does Superman do to Lois' kidnapper?
questions.correct: Hangs him from a telephone pole
options: Leaves him hog-tied in front of the Governor's house
Hands him over to the police
questions.explanation:
Hangs him from a telephone pole.

	Superman leaves Butch to hang helplessly from a telephone pole.

questions.text: What is the name of the senator Superman discovers is being influenced by "furtive" sources?
questions.explanation:
Barrows.

	Senator Barrows is seen talking to a "furtive" man, Alex Greer, "the slickest lobbyist in Washington."  Greer is getting the senator to pass a bill that will entangle the U.S. into European affairs.
